title: me getting perma banned for saying "kys" once and didn't even mean "kill your self"
body:
So about 4 months ago my account Minl Doge got perma because i have a 2 feeding trolls in my game running down and being very toxic now i know almost everyone in the community doesn't just let someone flamed them so i did come back being kinda toxic they were feeding and haveing a very bad game or something and i told him "kys" which at my school we use that term as "know your style" in the logs riot belives i meant to say kill your self but never did look for yourself. I feel like i should be unbanned bc off how long i played the game for and how much i supportred it by spening over $2000+ on the game by buying in game purchases and merch i would want the community to respond to help me out here on what should be decided. I know i was toxic but people change and how much i supported the game and how long ive played for i feel like not giving me a 2nd chance would be wrong because of how long ive stuck with the game from the good times to the bad times of it. thank you all for reading this. :D 
Minl Doge: just lost us the game
Minl Doge: that was free gold for me
Minl Doge: to carry
Minl Doge: ur so bad
Minl Doge: kys
Minl Doge: i mean good job
Minl Doge: gj wuk
Minl Doge: ur really good at this game

replies.body:
While Necromancy may be handy (and sometimes needed) in video games, it's not the case for old forum threads. Please avoid using such magic and be mindful of how old threads are before posting.

Feel free to contact us at the [Moderation Discord](https://discordapp.com/channels/230113905668653056/306220435262144512) or at [Discuss the Boards]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) for any questions, comments or concerns about this. Thank you and have a good day.

This is your 13th penalty, and you just came off a 14-day ban recently where you were told the next penalty would be a perma-ban.

You only posted a few lines out of your very long, very bad chatlog .. and multiple logs were given. Even without KYS .. which most certainly does not mean 'know your style' you would have been banned.

If you want to post the chat log in its entirety I'm happy to discuss further.

your right about that but i messaged a riot employee and the reason i was banned for was "kys" he said thats the only reason iw as perma banned because they dont tollerate it at all. What if instead giving such a harsh ban where i cant play since i was banned for typing and abusing i just dont understand why im not just perma chat banned not perma banned so i cant play the game...? I wasnt one of the feeders and trolls running it down feeding where they deserve perma bans but instead i re acted to them and got banned i feel i should be perma chat banned not banned from playing a game i supported so much spending over $2000 on and getting no sympathy or a chance? Just a thought i would actually enjoy getting perma chat banned so i cant be toxic because it would probably help my games way more.

Giving your history of fudging details, misleading narrative, and outright manipulated facts via incomplete chatlog, I will have to ask for a FULL UNEDITED transcript of the rito employee telling you that the ONLY reason you are permed
https://gyazo.com/7d1f95fe8800a4961489ef037ffb2010     here is a screenshot if i copy and pasted it here it would be way to long and big so here the screenshot of the spot where i was suspended for.

Even though that isn't what they asked for, it is still edited chat logs.

There are 134 lines of in-game chat and 15 games of post-game chat in the game you are posting in this screenshot.

> screenshot of the spot where i was suspended for.

That isn't the spot you were suspended for. The system looks at your logs in their entirety. It does not do a line-by-line analysis. Therefore, you were suspended for the entire log.

Oh well the email said i was perma banned for telling someone to "kys" and that is why i was perma banned that is what about the 4 emails i sent to riot about they all said the same thing they didnt say anything else also what about right after i said "kys" kinda wierd how you guys didn't notice it was a joke i literally said "i mean good job" thats what i dont get either and then what about all the positive things also you guys never noticed that im guessing...

later
wuk
hae fun
u literally just lost us the game
kys
i mean good job
gj wuk
ur really good at this game

Yeah, you totally said 'gj' and 'ur really good at this game' in a totally serious, not sarcastic in the least, way .. especially given all the other chat you're not showing.

We have a zero tolerance policy about telling people to kill themselves, so you claim it's something else. You were harassing people, so they are all jokes. You sarcastically say 'good job' to people who are doing poorly, so you were doing it sincerely. You paste small, composed, screenshots and selective snippets of chat. You are completely ignoring the other game given in your reform card.

The bottom line here is you were given numerous warnings, more than you should have IMHO.
You were told the next penalty would be a perma-ban.
You continued this behavior.
You got banned.

Player support already looked into this, review it, found the penalty to be appropriate, and said the penalty will stand.
I looked into this, reviewed it, and find that you have been dishonest in your presentation of this and are deserving of your penalty.

Please, feel free to post your chat logs in their ENTIRETY if you'd like to get other peoples' opinions of this.
Do i have a risk to get  banned if during a losing game i say "f.u.c.k you " to a teammate when i obviously.want.to say "For Untold Cases of Koala, You Own the  Universe" ?
{{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}}

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=0014000200000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-10-09T23:31:27.992+0000)
>
> later
> wuk
> hae fun
> u literally just lost us the game
> kys
> i mean good job
> gj wuk
> ur really good at this game
> 
> Yeah, you totally said 'gj' and 'ur really good at this game' in a totally serious, not sarcastic in the least, way .. especially given all the other chat you're not showing.
> 
> We have a zero tolerance policy about telling people to kill themselves, so you claim it's something else. You were harassing people, so they are all jokes. You sarcastically say 'good job' to people who are doing poorly, so you were doing it sincerely. You paste small, composed, screenshots and selective snippets of chat. You are completely ignoring the other game given in your reform card.
> 
> The bottom line here is you were given numerous warnings, more than you should have IMHO.
> You were told the next penalty would be a perma-ban.
> You continued this behavior.
> You got banned.
> 
> Player support already looked into this, review it, found the penalty to be appropriate, and said the penalty will stand.
> I looked into this, reviewed it, and find that you have been dishonest in your presentation of this and are deserving of your penalty.
> 
> Please, feel free to post your chat logs in their ENTIRETY if you'd like to get other peoples' opinions of this.


@Tantrum: is there any way I could get you to look into this: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/zEwLEGIb-riot-a-please-for-a-friend

If so I can go further into detail in a more private setting as to not call out account names and I can have my friend give a case reference number. 

If you have a way to add me on League or send a dm somewhere or however you choose, I would be very grateful just for a little bit your time
Lol know your style... that's a new one for me..

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=0014,timestamp=2018-10-08T17:59:20.126+0000)
>
> This is your 13th penalty, and you just came off a 14-day ban recently where you were told the next penalty would be a perma-ban.
> 
> You only posted a few lines out of your very long, very bad chatlog .. and multiple logs were given. Even without KYS .. which most certainly does not mean 'know your style' you would have been banned.
> 
> If you want to post the chat log in its entirety I'm happy to discuss further.

Maybe direct him to how to unbind his enter key and give him one more chance (He can do it Via AutoHotKey), see if he can make it a few months without typing at all in game.

First off, the guy got thirteen penalties, the last of which was a permanent ban. I don't think he needs "one more chance."

Second...

> Maybe direct him to how to unbind his enter key...
>
> ...see if he can make it a few months without typing at all in game.

Isn't that _cheating_?

Like, not in the direct "break the rules instant ban" kind of cheating, but, like. If your proposing that he gets challenged to go without typing anything, _unbinding his Enter key would certainly be cheating._
Lol. No one is that gullible even in your second thread.

What in the fresh hell would "know your style" even mean?

Either way, it's abundantly clear that you meant "kill yourself". You wouldn't have used "kys" if that wasn't what you meant. No amount of made up shenanigans like "know your style" or "kiss yourself" or whatever the hell else will change what "kys" means.

I edited out the links. All these are from a simple Google search. Within the first 5 pages of results.

> KYS Products -  ... **Dozen Pack** Embroidered "Mason" Masonic Baseball Caps Hats (Assorted) - 21548. KYS. $47.88. Add to Cart.

> KYS Express Inc is a family owned business that has been providing freight transportation and logistic services to various sized companies. KYS express, Inc.

> Buy KYS Men Aloha Shirt Vintage Cars Surf Palm and other Casual Button-Down Shirts at . Our wide selection is elegible for free shipping and free ...

> Listen to K.Y.S. now. Listen to K.Y.S. in full in the  app. Play on . Legal · Privacy · Cookies · About Ads. To play this content, you'll need the  ...

> Why is KYS so special? Our site is designed as a kosher and modest online platform to give frum, Jewish singles an opportunity to connect to one another and to ...

On top of that, tons of subjective hits such as, "what does kys stand for?". 

Not to mention, IFS is machine learning based on YEARS of reports. IFS did not detect kys. It was manually added to the zero tolerance system after people started insisting that kys was the worst thing in the world. (Probably because at the time, United States children were intentionally eating cleaning supplies and freely using all sorts of suicide themes.)

> I edited out the links. All these are from a simple Google search. Within the first 5 pages of results.

Ah, yes, because when you're playing a game of League, you're going to be recommending people a _freighting/logistics company_, or suggesting a _Jewish dating site_, or advertising _baseball caps._

Those cases are so close to the edge that they've already fallen over and landed in the frickin' valley.

If you're going to look for reasonable uses of the initialism "KYS", look for those that may actually show up in a game of League. Don't just pull company/brand names from a Google Search and expect it to suffice for an argument.

You are making assumptions about my argument. I simply showed that the entire world is not up to speed on video game lingo. FACT: Not EVERYONE knows what "kys" means. FACT: "kys" has multiple meanings.

The majority of this community understands it to mean "kill yourself" in the same way they understand "gg" to mean "good game". If you have to explain that you're using a non-standard abbreviation, then you probably shouldn't use the abbreviation. 

This argument is like trying to defend the mom who texts "Grandma died, lol". No, no one read it as "lots of love," which is why your whole family started asking what's wrong with you and if it was a sick joke.

> The majority of this community understands it to mean "kill yourself" in the same way they understand "gg" to mean "good game".

You have no data. You are pulling shit out of your ass.

If anything, the data is against you. IFS did not identify "kys" as a negative term. Which means it is either not popular, or only very recently became popular. Either way, leads to some people not being informed.

A short Google search later, and every single result on the front page comes back with "kill your self", [including the Dictionary.com acronyms result](https://www.dictionary.com/e/acronyms/kys/). Your notion that it's a commonly understood to mean anything else holds very little water when no one else is defining it any other way.

It is a relatively recent trend. Some of the before mentioned results are people asking about it on the Boards, around Sept 2016. Less than a year later it had been adopted by the zero tolerance system. It replaced the *significantly* older "drink bleach" and "I hope you get hit by a bus" as the 'cool and edgy' thing to say.

>  Your notion that it's a commonly understood to mean anything else holds very little water when no one else is defining it any other way.

NO ONE ELSE? NO ONE ELSE? I just fabricated those Google results out of thin air? 

> It is a relatively recent trend.

Ding, ding, ding. TREND. AKA not everyone. AKA NOT NO ONE ELSE.

> Some of the before mentioned results are people asking about it on the Boards

You admit in your own post that some people are unaware of what the acronym meant.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=00020001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-08T20:37:54.793+0000)
>
> NO ONE ELSE? NO ONE ELSE? I just fabricated those Google results out of thin air? 

Not "thin air", but certainly not by searching "what does kys mean?" You struggled to find *anyone* using the abbrebiation in *any* other context. 

> Ding, ding, ding. TREND. AKA not everyone. AKA NOT NO ONE ELSE.
> 
> You admit in your own post that some people are unaware of what the acronym meant.

What I am saying is that widespread use of "kys" as an acronym started 2 years ago. Those who have used it before that time (AKA your examples) didn't feel the need to define it for widespread use because it wasn't intended for widespread use. It's a trend because it will likely be replaced with another toxic phrase, much like how "drink bleach" was phased out (although with how short it is it might last).  

You're catching yourself in a chicken and the egg problem. An acronym only makes sense to use on it's own (like the OP did) if people know it. The OP assumed people would know it meant a school slogan? Or that (as other players have suggested) it meant "kiss your sister" - a phrase which was never used in gaming before "kill yourself" became a common acronym? 

Fat chance. "kys" might mean something else in some specialized environment, but in gaming it's got one meaning.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2018-10-08T16:34:54.942+0000)
>
> You are making assumptions about my argument. I simply showed that the entire world is not up to speed on video game lingo. FACT: Not EVERYONE knows what "kys" means. FACT: "kys" has multiple meanings.

The F word has multiple meanings too in the UK, as does an American slang word for Chinese people, and certain other words that are used in hate speech. Those words are not excused because multiple meanings exist, because in 99.9% of any case where these words are used in videogames, it's to be used as hate speech. Multiple definitions of words and expressions mean nothing if the more widely understood definitions are hateful and horrible.
Maybe if you stopped INSISTING that these words are inherently hateful, a non-hateful definition could be more common.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=000200010000000000010000,timestamp=2018-10-08T20:08:03.486+0000)
>
> Maybe if you stopped INSISTING that these words are inherently hateful, a non-hateful definition could be more common.

I'm not insisting, I'm stating what is. You can't simply change what words mean by personally believing they don't mean what they mean. That's delusional. Those words ARE inherently hateful in society now because of the nasty and hateful things that have been used and preached in conjunction with them. You cannot simply erase the nastiness attributed to these words in the past because you want to use another definition for a word that now qualifies as hate speech.

> I'm not insisting, I'm stating what is.

Same thing.

> You can't simply change what words mean by personally believing they don't mean what they mean.

Yes I can. Anyone can.

>That's delusional.

Opposite.

>Those words ARE inherently hateful in society** now **because of the nasty and hateful things that have been used and preached in conjunction with them. 

That one bold word fucks your entire argument. It means there was a time when those words were NOT inherently hateful. Which means the definition is capable of being changed. 

> You cannot simply erase the nastiness attributed to these words in the past because you want to use another definition for a word that now qualifies as hate speech.

The emotion of hate is not limited by language. Banning words does not change intentions. It creates new words.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=00020001000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-08T20:26:48.482+0000)
>
> Same thing.

Making a statement of fact is not an insistence. Please learn what "insisting" is. "Insisting" means "applying social pressure with constant and persistent use or action." A simple statement of fact is not "insisting."

> 
> Yes I can. Anyone can.

No you can't, anyone cannot. Word meanings, understandings, and social norms are determined by the collective mind of society, not a few individuals. Society as an entire whole has to change the meanings and understandings in order for it to be acceptable, so unless you can manage to convince society as a whole to erase the years of disgustingly bad history associated with hate speech, you cannot simply change a meaning of a word by personally deciding to have it mean something else.

> 
> Opposite.

"Delusion -
an personal belief or impression that is firmly maintained despite being contradicted by what is generally accepted as reality or rational argument."

If you are in firm belief that a word means something that isn't accepted as rational or reality by society, that is the textbook definition of delusional. If you are insisting that words that are hate speech aren't hate speech and can be used by their other meanings, you are delusional because the rest of society considers those words hate speech and will not tolerate their use.

> 
> That one bold word fucks your entire argument. It means there was a time when those words were NOT inherently hateful. Which means the definition is capable of being changed. 

It doesn't fuck anything. Those words are hate speech because society has accepted them as hate speech. The only time they weren't considered hate speech was when the people those words were used to put down had no power or representation to contradict their use. They are hate speech now because those groups of people are respected by society now, and terms that demean them or attempt to make them inferior citizens are not tolerated.

> 
> The emotion of hate is not limited by language. Banning words does not change intentions. It creates new words.

No shit. That's irrelevant to the point.

> " A simple statement of fact is not "insisting."

You aren't stating a fact. You are insisting that you are though. 

> Word meanings, understandings, and social norms are determined by the collective mind of society, not a few individuals. 

WRONG. If I decide to get pissed off every time someone says "hello", you can't stop me.

The few individuals create culture. That culture is spread locally. The most popular culture spreads regionally and beyond. It is called being a "trend setter".

> Those words are hate speech because society has accepted them as hate speech. 

Society hasn't done shit. Your personal social culture has made a decision and is now trying to enforce it on the rest of society.

> No shit. That's irrelevant to the point.

Then you are missing the point. You are arguing for banning words, while doing nothing against the actual hate. It's fucking hilarious how you think "bad" people are the only ones that can create language.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=0002000100000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-08T20:52:14.394+0000)
>
> You aren't stating a fact. You are insisting that you are though. 

Ok. Believe what you want. You've made it abundantly clear that words only mean what you think they mean, and no one else can tell you otherwise.

> 
> WRONG. If I decide to get pissed off every time someone says "hello", you can't stop me.
> 
> The few individuals create culture. That culture is spread locally. The most popular culture spreads regionally and beyond. It is called being a "trend setter".

No, I can't stop you. But people will shun you, stop interacting with you, and apply negative pressures on you, like reporting you to your managers at work if you're being a dick to them.
Individuals _can_ create a culture, but in order for that culture to have a backbone and become a trend, it has to be _accepted._ If people do not accept the social norms you are trying to establish, you are a social anomaly and will be treated as a pariah. 
A cultural norm that took root and was accepted was that people are people, no matter what they look like, who they love, or where they come from, and deserve respect. People learned that, and have accepted that, and will not tolerate people to use language that has previously been used to demean other groups of people out of a sign of respect.

> 
> Society hasn't done shit. Your personal social culture has made a decision and is now trying to enforce it on the rest of society.

Society has accepted that hate speech is hate speech, and will not tolerate it's use. It has determined that people who try to use hate speech will be shunned and cast out. Society has already accepted that that language is taboo because of it's years of use by bigots and other horrible people, and is currently not accepting any attempts to use those words for their "other definitions."

> 
> Then you are missing the point. You are arguing for banning words, while doing nothing against the actual hate. It's fucking hilarious how you think "bad" people are the only ones that can create language.

Again, this is not the point. The point is that some words are accepted as hate speech, despite the fact that they may have secondary definitions not associated with hate speech. However, because those words are primarily used as hate speech, attempts to use their "other definitions" are not accepted by society because society has accepted them as hate speech.

Just absurd. Everyone knows what it means, and frankly, the OP's logs don't even offer an alternative acronym. Having only said it once and now being permabanned says that he's probably already aware of this infraction from a prior penalty.
Frankly, you are the absurd one. Expecting the entire world to know and obey your specific culture.

By that reasoning, you shouldn't be upset if someone intentionally feeds or trolls in your games. How were they suppose to know that was something that makes people upset or is against the rules?

Shame on you for expecting the entire world to know and obey your specific culture.

>How were they suppose to know that was something that makes people upset or is against the rules?

There are tons of cues. I'm not sure you can really claim ignorance on intentional feeding a ranked game. Intentionally feeding while being new, absolutely able to claim ignorance.

> Shame on you for expecting the entire world to know and obey your specific culture.

If you read the first part, you would realize that I am flexible with cultural expectations. I don't expect everyone to use the same culture.

>There are tons of cues. I'm not sure you can really claim ignorance on intentional feeding a ranked game. Intentionally feeding while being new, absolutely able to claim ignorance.

There are tons of cues that "kys" means kill yourself to anyone that has spent any time online, much less league of legend. You can't really claim ignorance of the term after spending any amount of time online.
Google disagrees.
Google actually **agrees** seeing as the vast majority of results of the acronym describes it as "kill yourself" and not any of the alternatives you listed.
Then why do people ask what it means? Can't they read the context clues?
If they don't know what "kys" means, how would you explain them using it? You can't both not understand what it means and intentionally use it for some extremely obscure meaning.

You can't even keep up. The "victim" isn't using "kys". The victim is asking what "kys" means. 

If the meaning was so well understood, then people wouldn't be asking what it means. Then people like you, go and tell them it means hate. Now, they get offended whenever they see "kys". You propagate the hate.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=000200010001000000000000000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2018-10-08T20:59:34.931+0000)
>You can't even keep up. The "victim" isn't using "kys". The victim is asking what "kys" means.

Then you've gone completely outside the bounds of the argument. This is a discussion about someone **using the term**.

OP claimed that they meant, "know your style" and others called the OP out on the obvious lie.

> [{quoted}](name=mlm olo mlm,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=00020001000100000000000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-09T01:15:06.470+0000)
>
> You have no proof it was a lie.

You mean other than all the other points that people brought up? 

Sure. But if you're going to go with that route, you have no proof that anyone anywhere has ever intentionally fed since it's impossible for you to determine the intent of another human being without being that person.

So in light of that Riot, as well as any other person, judges based on reasonable doubt. This is not a case where there is enough reasonable doubt to believe the OP.

I use KS all the time -  Kill Steal.  What happens when my fat fingers hit KYS?

I get banned for having fat fingers?
Just playing the devil's advocate here, but the German keyboard layout (QWERTZ) actually has Z and Y swapped, placing Y half left below the S, so pretty close.
while that may be true, he is posting from an NA account so it's a safe assumption thats not the case

As said… devil's advocate.
I mean, I was honestly considering it could be a German player with an NA account, but given a recent rant on not giving another "dollar" to Riot, yeah, I guess it is indeed a safe assumption that they are using QWERTY.

I mean, you can also just say immediately afterwards that you are sorry and didn't mean to say that term. While the system will pick it up, a Rioter would probably cut you some slack if the see the context behind it. While its kinda annoying, I really don't think you could get banned for it in the long run as long as the chat logs check out.

> [{quoted}](name=CharDeeMcDenniz,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=xfl0teU4,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2018-10-07T20:09:02.155+0000)
>
> lolwut?
> 
> Y is nowhere near K or S
> 
> {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Not on your keyboard layout. On mine it's right under s. You do know that the keyboard layout you use is not universal, right?

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
Zero tolerance means zero tolerance.
